thread.title: Comedian Rhod Gilbert's in Cardiff for the Wales v England rugby clash - but his tickets are back home in London
thread.title_full: Comedian Rhod Gilbert's in Cardiff for the Wales v England rugby clash - but his tickets are back home in London

author: Suchandrika Chakrabarti
title: Comedian Rhod Gilbert's in Cardiff for the Wales v England rugby clash - but his tickets are back home in London
text:
Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Rhod Gilbert was in severe danger of not making the epic Wales v England rugby clash, which is due to start later this afternoon. 
The comedian headed down to Cardiff early doors, and it was only when midway through his morning chat show on BBC Radio Wales that he realised the terrible mistake. 
Without the tickets, he was in danger of being barred from the sold out match at the city's Principality Stadium. 
Rhod, speaking with his radio colleague Chris Corcoran, said: "My head is in a spin and my feet won't touch the floor and though I'm not normally one to quote Kelle Marie, I am actually in a bit of a spin. The Principality Stadium, Cardiff - will Rhod make it in?? (Photo: PA Wire) 
"Ladies and gentlemen, I am supposed to be going to the game at wherever it's called these days but my tickets are on the fridge at home in London. 
"Yes! Me! Oh man, I'm fed up with this life of mine. I'm always on the road, I'm never in my house, my dog's in the kennels, I'm on the radio, my wife is in London and my tickets are in London." 
Rhod explained that he had bought four tickets "and I gave two tickets to my friend Tim Key, from Inside Number 9, as his mum and dad wanted to go and mine are in London. Yes, Rhod, you might well make that face! 
"I'm trying to get hold of his mum to ask 'What ticket numbers are yours?' so then I can contact the Welsh Rugby Union and say I've got the tickets next to them and I can't get hold of his mum. Carol isn't answering the phone. 
"Anyway, long story short. Wales take on England today at the stadium and my tickets are on the fridge-magneted to the fridge." 
He asked his wife Sian to take a photo of the tickets that he could show to the WRU but she texted him back to say she was out but eventually, after much panic, he sorted it out thanks to co-host Chris, who rang his friend in the WRU ticket office who saved the day. 
Phew. 
You can catch Rhod's show on BBC iPlayer . Like us on Facebook
